data.title: Wow architecture
data.text: It is a great public space.  The dome is rentable for events.  Exterior space is a great place to sit and people watch.

data.title: Don't just pass it by!
data.text: City Hall is beautiful from the outside -- but it's a PUBLIC building -- so you should visit the inside too!  The front/public elevators go all the way to the 17th floor -- and the view from up there is awesome -- especially at sunset.  At different times during the year, each floor and the hallway between the Rotunda and the Wing rooms hold art show/displays.  Check them out!

data.title: Sleek and Modern, But Not Very Impressive
data.text: For the tenth largest city inthe country, the new San Jose City Hall is not very impressive. The best thing about it are the fountains in a large open patio area. However, they were not working when we visited. Altholugh we are in a drought, the water could be recycled. There should be more seating in the open areas around the building. The chamber room is just OK with little by way of decor.

data.title: Silicon Valley City Hall
data.text: If you doubt the future is being shaped here, the new city hall should change that, much of it is underground, but the above ground portion is one beautiful work of art.

data.title: Cool building
data.text: I've been at City Hall for a few meetings and I enjoy the building, but it is a bit confusing to navigate with a few different towers. Allow yourself some time if you have an appointment. The general info desks - permits, etc. - are in the main section on the bottom floor.

data.title: If you're in the area
data.text: For a city hall building this one is pretty nice, there is a lot of room to walk around and 2 water fixtures.  It's really pretty if you're walking by but as far as things to do in San Jose, it's not really worth the extra trip.

data.title: Expensive Piece of Cement
data.text: Viewing this building from the east, it appears to be a typical boring high rise, however this one cost a mint.  The misting polls are truly an expensive joke, first time I saw them I thought something was on fire.  What a waste of taxpayers money.

data.title: attended some meetings
data.text: as a city hall goes, it is accessible and has staff on ground floor that can help you get to where you need to be

data.title: It's a city hall
data.text: I wouldn't rate the San Jose City Hall as a tourist destination. It's a city hall with moderately interesting modern architectural elements.

data.title: very nice play and the architecture!
data.text: have respect for the engineer who brought san jose this unique gem. Can't get enough of the flags in wind. That's about all I can say, happy Saturday!

data.title: Got to see how your money is wasted
data.text: Although this is a giant boondoggle, it is beautiful and interesting for a public building.  At Xmas they have light shows and other events in the dome area.

data.title: Beautiful Dome.
data.text: SJ city hall is pretty and very informative. There is information you can get on any number of questions you may have. Great resource as well as education opportunities.

data.title: Ultra-Modern Architecture
data.text: A handsome building that houses the city offices. The architecture is quite modern and different from modernist structures that dominate downtown San Jose. Particularly striking is the domed entryway, the building however does not offer much and is located on the outskirts of downtown in an area where you're likely to run into some esseys or homeys

data.title: City Hall
data.text: Just an average looking building which houses City Hall and it's employees. At night it looks a little more interesting and is shown on the local news channels. There are tall misters closer to the street for the hot summer days, making it nice to walk under.

data.title: City of San Jose
data.text: The first floor is the only placeto see the past of the city.  Parking is limited and expensive.  The is no real reason for visitors to visit this place.  AND if you are dining downtown go early, not a place to be after hours.

data.title: Well-oiled City Government
data.text:
I spend a lot of time in City Hall because I supply clothes to many of the departments.  Since it was first built, I have admired this place for a couple of reasons.  First,  it is a beautiful building complex, bright and airy even on rainy days.  Each floor in the Tower has a beautiful Cityscape.

2ndly, the place runs like a clock.  There are a couple of lines of course (bustling Planning & Development) but there is an order to the place.  Every day.
3rd, the people who work there are friendly and helpful.  Almost to the one.  It is an incredible statement about San Jose when you take it all in.  I am truly proud to be from this area whenever I visit this building/enterprise!

data.title: City Hall
data.text: Beautiful architecture. Stately looking. It's a place that was fun to walk to. I enjoyed looking at the modern architecture for a city hall.

data.title: A beautiful building in the heart of the city
data.text: SJ City Hall resembles something you'd expect to represent the heart of Silicon Valley. It's a nice location to sit and watch people go by, or enjoy a bite to eat. There's not a lot to do at this site that doesn't revolve around business, but you can definitely look at the exhibits inside that give you a bit of background about the local area (not being from this area, it was very interesting to me). It's a good place to relax when you aren't in a hurry and just want to see great architecture and a bit of history.

data.title: Capital of Silicon Valley home resembles R2D2
data.text: The home of many city offices, I never mind going as it is so beautifully designed and creates a relaxing vibe. A great place to grab a lunch, sit and relax.  There are great exhibits of local history on the interior.  I find it fitting the nerd capital building resembles R2D2.

data.title: Architecturally Beautiful City Hall in San Jose
data.text:
We like the architecture of the San Jose City Hall. It is in the downtown area of San Jose and is close to San Jose State University.  It is where the mayor and city offices are.

The architecture is beautiful.  It was designed by architect Richard Meier. It is a landmark in San Jose. The rotunda is stunning beautiful to look at.

As a visitor, it is nice to look at.  One can also rent out the rotunda area of City Hall for a wedding. It can seat up to 250 people.
